intro: Scleranthus tenuicaulis, commonly known as slenderstem sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its fruits are small, dry, and three-angled. Scleranthus tenuicaulis is generally short-lived and completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
